com.labyrinth.game

Class SettingsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.labyrinth.game.SettingsManager

  • public class SettingsManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages settings and configurations for the Labyrinth game. Allows for the loading and saving of configuration files. If an invalid or non-existant file is passed, the default settings are used.
    Version:
    0.1.24032013
    Author:
    Gareth Gill, John Meikle

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SettingsManager()
      Construct a SettingsManager with default settings.
      SettingsManager(java.lang.String path)
      Construct a SettingsManager with predefined settings.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SettingsManager

        public SettingsManager()
        Construct a SettingsManager with default settings.

      • SettingsManager

        public SettingsManager(java.lang.String path)
        Construct a SettingsManager with predefined settings. If the file is invalid or does not exist, then default settings are used. The user is notified of this via the standard output.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the settings file.

    • Method Detail

      • setDefault

        public void setDefault()
        Set all the values in the settings to their default values.

      • load

        public void load(java.lang.String path)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Explicitly load settings in from a specified file path. Must be in the format: ROWS COLUMNS LEADERBOARD
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the settings file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when the file is not found or invalid.

      • save

        public void save(java.lang.String path)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Save the current defined settings to a specified settings file. Will be in the format of: ROWS COLUMNS LEADERBOARD
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the settings file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when can't write to file.

      • getRows

        public int getRows()
        Get the number of rows.

        Set the leaderboard path.
